DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : A low-fat , high-fiber diet may slow growth prostate cancer . PURPOSE : Randomized phase II trial compare effectiveness low-fat , high-fiber diet standard diet treat patient prostate cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Low-Fat , High-Fiber Diet Compared Standard Diet Treating Patients With Prostate Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Compare inhibition growth human prostate cancer cell line serum patient prostate cancer feed low fat , high fiber diet . - Determine underlie mechanism low fat , high fiber diet affect growth prostate cancer cell line . - Determine whether low fat , high fiber diet inhibits growth prostate cancer cell line androgen-dependent and/or androgen- independent mechanism patient . - Determine growth factor , hormone , and/or bind protein may responsible affect growth prostate cancer cell line patient . OUTLINE : This randomize study . Patients randomize 1 2 arm . - Arm I : Patients receive low fat , high fiber diet daily 3 week . - Arm II : Patients receive control diet contain standard amount fat fiber . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 40 patient ( 20 per arm ) accrue study within 6 month .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Diagnosis adenocarcinoma prostate Previously untreated watchful wait Medically able receive dietary intervention PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age : 40 80 Performance status : Not specify Life expectancy : Not specify Hematopoietic : Not specify Hepatic : Not specify Renal : Not specify Other : Must willing travel UCLA 3 day week 4 week obtain specially prepared food PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Biologic therapy : Not specify Chemotherapy : Not specify Endocrine therapy : No concurrent luteinizing hormonereleasing hormone agonist ( leuprolide goserelin ) No concurrent androgenreceptor block agent ( flutamide bicalutamide ) No concurrent testosterone No concurrent insulin No concurrent finasteride Radiotherapy : Not specify Surgery : No prior orchiectomy Other : No concurrent saw palmetto supplement
